gurmukhi: ਰਿਪ ਫਿਰੇ ਮਾਰ ਦੁੰਦਭ ਬਜਾੲਿ || ੳੁਤ ਭਜੇ ਦੲੀਤ ਦਲਪਤਿ ਜੁਝਾੲਿ ||੪੮੨||
transliteration: Rip Phire Maar Doundabh Bajaae|| Out Bhaje Daeet Dalpat(i) Jujhaae||482||
translation: Lakshman returned with his forces, playing on the drum and on the other side the demons ran away on seeing their general dead.482.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਤਿ ੲਿੰਦ੍ਰਜੀਤ ਬਧਹਿ ਧਿਅਾੲਿ ਸਮਾਪਤਮ ਸਤੁ ||
transliteration: It(i) Idrajeet Badhah(i) Dhiaae Samaapatam Sat(u)||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled “The Killing of Inderjit’ in Ramavtar in BACHITTAR NATAK.
Now begins the description of the war with the demon Atkaaye :

gurmukhi: ਕਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਕੋਪ ਕੈ ਦੲੀਤ ਰਾਜ || ਜਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਜੁੱਧ ਕੋ ਸਜਯੋ ਸਾਜ ||
transliteration: Kaagaddan Kop Kai Daeet Raaj|| Jaagaddan Judh Ko Sajyo Saaj||
translation: The demon-king in great fury, began the war,

gurmukhi: ਬਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਬੀਰ ਬੁੱਲੇ ਅਨੰਤ || ਰਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਰੋਸ ਰੋਹੇ ਦੁਰੰਤ ||੪੮੩||
transliteration: Baagaddan Beer Bulle Anant|| Raagaddan Ros Rohe Durant||483||
translation: Calling his innumerable warriors, full of resentment and very wrathful.483.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਪਰਮ ਬਾਜੀ ਬੁਲੰਤ || ਚਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਚੱਤ੍ਰ ਨਟ ਜਯੋਂ ਕੁਦੰਤ ||
transliteration: Paagaddan Param Baajibulant|| Chaagaddan Chattra Nat Jyon Kudant||
translation: Very swift-moving horses were brought who jumped hither and thither like and actor;

gurmukhi: ਕਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਕ੍ਰੂਰ ਕੱਢੇ ਹਥਿਅਾਰ || ਅਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਅਾਨ ਬੱਜੇ ਜੁਝਾਰ ||੪੮੪||
transliteration: Kaagaddan Kroor Kaddhe Hathiaar|| Aagaddan Aan Bajje Jujhaar||484||
translation: Taking out their frightening weapons, the warriors began to fight with one another.484.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਰਾਮ ਸੈਨਾ ਸੁ ਕ੍ਰੁੱਧ || ਜਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਜ੍ਵਾਨ ਜੁਝੰਤ ਜੁੱਧ ||
transliteration: Raagaddan Raam Sainaa Su Kruddh|| Jaagaddan Jvaan Jujhant Juddh||
translation: On this side, the warriors in the army of Ram, started fighting in great rage;

gurmukhi: ਨਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਨਿਸਾਣ ਨਵ ਸੈਨ ਸਾਜ || ਮਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਮੂੜ ਮਕਰਾਛ ਗਾਜ ||੪੮੫||
transliteration: Naagaddan Nisaan Nav Sain Saaj|| Maagaddan Moond Makraachh Gadj||485||
translation: The foolish Makrachh thundered, carrying his new banner.485.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਗੜਦੰਗ ੲੇਕ ਅਤਕਾੲਿ ਵੀਰ || ਰਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਰੋਸ ਕੀਨੇ ਗਹੀਰ ||
transliteration: Aagaddan Ek Atkaae Veer|| Raagaddan Ros Keene Gadeer||
translation: There was one demon named Atkaaye in the demon forces who rushed with serious fury;

gurmukhi: ਅਾਗੜਦੰਗ ੲੇਕਹੁੱਕੇ ਅਨੇਕ || ਸਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਸਿੰਧ ਬੇਲਾ ਬਿਬੇਕ ||੪੮੬||
transliteration: Aagaddan Ekahoukke Anek|| Saagaddan Sindh Belaa Bibek||486||
translation: Many warriors confronted him and began to fight with discriminating intellect.486.

gurmukhi: ਤਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਤੀਰ ਛੁਟੈ ਅਪਾਰ || ਬਾਗੜਦੰਗ ਬੂੰਦ ਬਨ ਦਲ ਅਨੁਚਾਰ ||
transliteration: Taagaddan Teer Chhoutai Apaar|| Baagaddan Boond Ban Dal Anouchaar||
translation: There was huge shower of arrows which fell like rain-drops;
